post.body: Appreciate the Office Accounting information! It does appear to be quite a bit more solid than QB.
Look forward to your feedback. Keep in m ind that the DNN sample is intended to be a genesis for discussion, not a final solution
At your leisure. DotNetNuke sample is tucked away at Samples/DotNetNuke AdaptedProvider Sample/LinqToEntitiesAdaptedDataProvider.cs.
I suspect the same, though I have not yet reviewed the source.
Via @irobinson via @robconery; this (http://is.gd/bE1d) seems a reasonably balanced assessment.
Absolutely!
TFS works wonderfully for the other projects I host on Codeplex; something is wrong with the one I just created (on their end).
Yep I'm a maverick, always eschewing the friendly TabId.
Option C: I prefer to avoid TabIds, so (when I link) I use the URI http://www.dotnetnuke.com/Products/Downloads.aspx.
Lessig is great. I highly recommend his Code 2.0 text, available online here: http://codev2.cc/
Sorry to hear that. Sounds like you've had a very frustrating day.
All shapes and sizes, though only the ones that win the race to 360,000 instances get to survive!
@WillStrohl In this case, though, it sure smells like Intuit sweetening its 2008 end-of-year balance sheet.
If one is diligent about submission, rebates are effectively a cash flow from those that don't to those that do.
Rebate breakage and slippage are magic for the balance sheet, and enough to ensure you'll never be able to redeem at checkout.
Off and on while working on other stuff. Longest part was the torrent nonsense due to my not being able to find an original CD.
I appreciate the blog-publicity @ http://is.gd/cm2b!
The DotNetNuke DAL+ is still considered a current best-practice, and has not yet been depreciated... correct?
"Bah, just reinstall IIS," he thought. "Nothing could possibly go wrong with that."
Trying green tea instead of coffee today. We'll see how that goes.
Does anyone have any development experience with Microsoft Office Accounting? I have had just about enough with the Quickbooks SDK.
Entity Framework IDataReader Adapter Generator project is now available. Blog: http://is.gd/bEdb Project: http://is.gd/bMHm
I wish CodePlex allowed float style specification.
Peer pressure? I just joined the dotnetnuke Twitter Group http://tgr.me/g/dotnetnuke and you can too. Please Retweet.
Bad news on the network neutrality front: http://is.gd/bHrS
CodePlex TFS is back to normal for my new project. Someone must have rebooted something this morning.
Blogged: "First Look: An Entity Framework (LINQ to Entity) to IDataReader Adapter." http://is.gd/bEdb
Reviewing MSCRM eService accelerator for use inside DNN (until my wife makes me stop).
My new CodePlex project's source control is still not working. Looks like I lost the server lottery.
Alas, if only CodePlex TFS was working properly...
Looking for someone interested in extending EF->IDataReader adapter project into a complete DotNetNuke data provider. http://is.gd/bMHm
Thirty-six hours without checking e-mail. It's been quite a long time since that's happened.
Simulating Internet worms.
Holiday bonus: getting to use the flyweight pattern in a research project.
This is an absurd patent application. Shame on them. http://is.gd/czAU
Lost in EBSCO.
Route flap: No Twitter in Egypt today. http://is.gd/cxtL
CodePlex homepage has a new layout. Nice of them to spruce things up!
I am looking for anyone with experience with internet worm architecture, and in particular use of hit-lists, for academic research purposes.
One torrent, 2 SP downloads, 1 SP install, 1 SP integration, 1 RSA key replacement, and 1 metabase restore later, my dev IIS lives again.
